DataElement.preferredName: Leukemic Extramedullary Central Nervous System Disease Diagnosis Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether leptomeningeal disease was present in the central nervous system (CNS) at the time an individual was diagnosed with leukemia.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Leukemic Extramedullary Central Nervous System Disease Diagnosis Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) hematologic disorder, involving hematopoietic stem cells and characterized by the presence of primitive or atypical myeloid or lymphoid cells in the bone marrow and the blood.  Leukemias are classified as acute or chronic based on the degree of cellular differentiation and the predominant cell type present.  Leukemia is usually associated with anemia, fever, hemorrhagic episodes and splenomegaly.  Common leukemias include acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic or precursor lymphoblastic leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia.  Treatment is vital to patient survival; untreated, the natural course of acute leukemias is normally measured in weeks or months, while that of chronic leukemias is more often measured in months or years.Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata._The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Occurrence; an instance of something happening._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) hematologic disorder, involving hematopoietic stem cells and characterized by the presence of primitive or atypical myeloid or lymphoid cells in the bone marrow and the blood.  Leukemias are classified as acute or chronic based on the degree of cellular differentiation and the predominant cell type present.  Leukemia is usually associated with anemia, fever, hemorrhagic episodes and splenomegaly.  Common leukemias include acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic or precursor lymphoblastic leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia.  Treatment is vital to patient survival; untreated, the natural course of acute leukemias is normally measured in weeks or months, while that of chronic leukemias is more often measured in months or years.:Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata.:The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) hematologic disorder, involving hematopoietic stem cells and characterized by the presence of primitive or atypical myeloid or lymphoid cells in the bone marrow and the blood. Leukemias are classified as acute or chronic based on the degree of cellular differentiation and the predominant cell type present. Leukemia is usually associated with anemia, fever, hemorrhagic episodes, and splenomegaly. Common leukemias include acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, acute lymphoblastic or precursor lymphoblastic leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia. Treatment is vital to patient survival; untreated, the natural course of acute leukemias is normally measured in weeks or months, while that of chronic leukemias is more often measured in months or years.
Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata.
The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other active site of extramedullary disease at the time of initiation of the conditioning regimen?
